original_definition: 'cross zonal capacity' means the capability of the interconnected system to accommodate energy transfer between bidding zones;
generated_definition: 'cross zonal capacity' means cross zonal capacity refers to the transmission capacity allocated across different zones or regions in the market, and can be explicitly or implicitly allocated, without or with energy transfer.
